definition: pouring of wine on ground for sacrifice
to fix/to settle/a libation to the dead
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield

sentences.english: The house of your God is deprived of offering and libation.
sentences.chinese: 因为素祭和奠祭在你们天主的殿内已中断了。

sentences.english: And thou shalt bring for a drink offering half an hin of wine， for an offering made by fire， of a sweet savour unto the LORD.
sentences.chinese: 又用酒半欣作奠祭，献给耶和华为馨香的火祭。

sentences.english: This is the burnt offering for every Sabbath, in addition to the regular burnt offering and its drink offering.
sentences.chinese: 这是在例行的燔祭和奠祭以外所加献安息日的燔祭。

sentences.english: Its drink offering shall be a quarter of a hin for each lamb.
sentences.chinese: 为这一只羊羔，要同献奠祭的酒一欣四分之一。

sentences.english: Pour out the drink offering to the Lord at the sanctuary.
sentences.chinese: 在圣所中，你要将醇酒奉给耶和华为奠祭。

definition: to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
to offer a sacrifice to (gods or ancestors)/memorial ceremony/(in classical novels) to recite an incantation to activate a magic weapon/(lit. and fig.) to wield
a worship ceremony for the dead/to offer sacrifice (to ancestors)/a libation
to worship/to observe religious rites/to pay one's respects (to one's ancestors etc)
the three sacrificial animals (originally cow, sheep and pig; later pig, chicken and fish)
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
